column4: hey guys, how do I change my updates/installs to unstable like I would in Debian?
I need to download bleeding egde stuff
and gutsy is not doing it
I need sshfs 1.9 and it's grabbing 1.7
do you want to upgrade to hardy or just install one package?
to upgrade to hardy, gksu "update-manager -d"
go to http://packages.ubuntu.com/hardy/ and download the deb you want
backports has a few select packages compiled for gutsy. not all of hardy's though
if it's there, you can use that. otherwise, you can download the deb from where i linked
if you do that, youd upgrae to hardy.  they said i shouldnt tell you to go to hardy.
i figure if you can handle Sid, you can handle Hardy just fine
Sid is Debian Unstable's name

Debian Unstable is called Sid.  Ubuntu's current unstable is Hardy.  You can install a package from Hardy without upgrading to it if you don't want to be running unstable (because that can involve lots of hair-pulling if you know what you're doing, and more if you don't). If you want to ride the unstable edge, you can, but it'd be easier to just install the one package.  You might be able to get the package from backports.  If you can't, you can g
http://packages.ubuntu.com
just download from there.  click on hardy, and go the section you want, and download teh deb
yes, you can download a deb and double click it
umm it is?
yep, you're right. go compile it if you need that new of one
why?
hardy is sync'd with whatever's in the current debian unstable repos
if debian has 1.9, just download their deb and hope it works
and really, if you dont know how debs work or about compiling, trying to muck with versions is probably a bad idea
